text: One of Mexico City’s most iconic dishes, tacos al pastor are made with marinated pork cooked on a vertical spit, served on small tortillas, and topped with onion, cilantro, and pineapple. A must-try street food classic.
Known locally as 'guajolota,' the torta de tamal is a Mexico City favorite for breakfast. It consists of a tamal placed inside a bolillo roll, making it a hearty and unique street food combination.

A staple of CDMX street food, quesadillas are folded tortillas filled with cheese or other ingredients like mushrooms, squash blossoms, or huitlacoche. Often fried on a comal, they highlight the city’s culinary diversity.
